title: Subnautica
notes:
Simply starting leads to missing textures, but can be fixed by using launch options, either:

"-force-opengl", "-force-glcore45" or "PROTON_USE_WINED3D11=1 %command%"

force-opengl works with all cards, force-glcore45 is faster but less compatible and PROTON_USE_WINED3D11 allows setting water quality to high.

You can increase framerate by adding "PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1"
and create a borderless window by adding "-popupwindow".
Example launch option:

"PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 PROTON_USE_WINED3D11=1  %command% -popupwindow"

notes:

title: Subnautica

notes: does not crash, but has sadly a ton of invisible materials, witch makes it hard to play and even harder to enjoy playing. VR is working, but has the same graphical bugs.
title: Subnautica

notes: Barely any Models in game show, Viewmodels don't work
title: Subnautica

notes: Ran with -force-opengl -> around 60 fps with no problems, -force-glcore45 gives like 10 fps and plays pretty smoothly. Every other option chopped fps to like 30 and had some glitches. Pretty playable overall
title: Subnautica

notes: Enable the experimental version under the steam beta tab for the game to fix the mouse issues after 10 minutes.  Disabled screen-space-reflections. -force-glcore45 (1080p fullscreen), only see very minor graphics glitches during scanning of new objects.  Otherwise no issues.  55-80fps on 120hz monitor.
title: Subnautica

notes:
Unless you force openGL in the launch settings view-models won't load. When ran on 390 LTS drivers the skybox didn't load whereas everything showed up correctly with 396.54 STS. Screenspace reflections caused graphical curruption to show up around glowing fish when they would reflect on rocksurfaces and such.

Playable framerates on lowest settings, was able to build a base and explore a few biomes without noticing anything gamebreaking.
title: Subnautica

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX 570 Series (POLARIS10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.6-arch1-1-ARCH, LLVM 6.0.1)

title: Subnautica

notes:
Launching without any options will start the game however many textures are missing.

Using -force-opengl or -force-glcore45 the game will run, but with other issues which required disabling screen space reflections.

Mouse issues were also present which required setting Subnautica to the Experimental build under the Steam Game options.
title: Subnautica

notes: Completed game 50 Hours, runs practically flawless with only minor glitches. Runs best for me with -force-opengl, borderless window mode and medium graphics settings.
title: Subnautica

notes: Works perfectly after forcing opengl.
title: Subnautica

notes: Adding -force-glcore45 to the launch options made this run almost perfectly but I had some very minor and occasional graphical errors, it isn't too distracting so it's playable.
title: Subnautica

notes:
Set Launch Options: PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 PROTON_USE_WINED3D11=1 %command% -popupwindow
Screen will occasionally freeze when press Esc; pressing Win key will fix; screen spinning with mouse control fixed by pressing Win key.

notes: The mouse goes wonky every so often, something to do with alt-tabbing I think, haven't found a reliable way to make it stop misbehaving besides bounce the game. Opening the PDA or anything with a menu, the mouse behaves, back to the view control, it's wonky.
title: Subnautica

notes: Used -force-glcore45 in launch options to fix the invisible textures and experimental in the Betas tab to fix the mouse issues. -force-glcore45 gave me a higher frame rate than any combination of Proton commands. Performance is good with custom settings, very playable.
title: Subnautica

notes: set launch options PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1  -force-opengl and its been running great on fullscreen at 1600x900 and 1920x1080 with low to mid settings (low settings only cause I have old hardware) performance is good with only a stutter here or there and the only animation that seems funny is the scanning. have not ventured beyond shallows and grassy plateaus.
title: Subnautica

notes: Tested in VR. Performance is very good. Couldn't figure out the controls, but I don't think that's a Proton issue.
title: Subnautica

notes: use opengl with -force-opengl in the start options. DirectX11 works but doesn't render everything. Use the experimental beta of the game if you have issues with your mouse.
title: Subnautica

notes: Fullscreen can occasionally be buggy and mouselock is weird, but otherwise the game is completely playable when the -force-opengl launch option.
